remarks: Lemma for ~ dcubic1 and ~ dcubic2 : simplify the cubic equation under the substitution ` X = U - M / U ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-Apr-2015.)
statement:
dcubic.c $e |- ( ph -> P e. CC ) $.
dcubic.d $e |- ( ph -> Q e. CC ) $.
dcubic.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. CC ) $.
dcubic.t $e |- ( ph -> T e. CC ) $.
dcubic.3 $e |- ( ph -> ( T ^ 3 ) = ( G - N ) ) $.
dcubic.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. CC ) $.
dcubic.2 $e |- ( ph -> ( G ^ 2 ) = ( ( N ^ 2 ) + ( M ^ 3 ) ) ) $.
dcubic.m $e |- ( ph -> M = ( P / 3 ) ) $.
dcubic.n $e |- ( ph -> N = ( Q / 2 ) ) $.
dcubic.0 $e |- ( ph -> T =/= 0 ) $.
dcubic2.u $e |- ( ph -> U e. CC ) $.
dcubic2.z $e |- ( ph -> U =/= 0 ) $.
dcubic2.2 $e |- ( ph -> X = ( U - ( M / U ) ) ) $.
dcubic1lem $p |- ( ph -> ( ( ( X ^ 3 ) + ( ( P x. X ) + Q ) ) = 0 <-> ( ( ( U ^ 3 ) ^ 2 ) + ( ( Q x. ( U ^ 3 ) ) - ( M ^ 3 ) ) ) = 0 ) ) $.
